title: <LH BN>: "Ready for the merge" ->  <GETH>: "Etherbase automatically configured" -> <LH BN>: "Not ready for merge" -> <LH BN>: "Ready for the merge"
body:
## Description

I just saw Lighthouse BN log: `"Not ready for merge"`, just half a second after GETH logged `"Etherbase automatically configured"` (which it rarely does), here is an excerpt of Lighthouse BN and GETH logs.

**Note that Lighthouse logs are offset by 2 hours, is this a bug in Lighthouse, relating to time zones? I think it related to: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/issues/3130**

## Version

```sh
$ lighthouse --version
Lighthouse v3.1.0-aa022f4
BLS library: blst
SHA256 hardware acceleration: false
Specs: mainnet (true), minimal (false), gnosis (false)
```

### geth version
```sh
$ geth version
Geth
Version: 1.11.0-unstable
Git Commit: 95a2c221d4c780346cf8766d1b416a8147d17e39
Git Commit Date: 20220831
Architecture: arm64
Go Version: go1.19
Operating System: darwin
GOPATH=
```

## Present Behaviour

In a "sea of" `"Ready for the merge"`, I saw one `"Not ready for the merge"`

## Expected Behaviour

I expect to only see `"Ready for the merge"`.

## Steps to resolve

I dunno.
That's OK. The "not ready" is just because Geth momentarily told you it wasn't synced. Lighthouse will keep trying to use Geth to validate blocks even if Geth is claiming not to be synced.
